## C2. Plot y = x^2
```{python}
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

x = np.linspace(-10, 10, 200)
y = x**2

plt.plot(x, y)
plt.xlabel("x")
plt.ylabel("y")
plt.title("y = x^2")
plt.show()
```

## Part D: LaTeX practice (math + formatting)

### D1. Inline math

The mean of the numbers $x_1, x_2, \ldots, x_n$ is given by $\frac{1}{n}\sum_{i=1}^n x_i$.

### D2. Display math

The quadratic formula is given by:
$$
x = \frac{-b \pm \sqrt{b^2 - 4ac}}{2a}.
$$

### D3. Aligned equations


\begin{align*}
(x + 1)^2 &= (x + 1)(x + 1) \\
          &= x^2 + 2x + 1
\end{align*}


### D4. LaTeX symbols

The symbol $\nabla$ denotes the gradient operator, which represents the vector of partial derivatives of a scalar-valued function.
